page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: {ARABLE. } VARYING DEPTHS OF{CLAY LOAM}COVERS FREE DRAINING ROCK AND MANY FIELDS HAVE{STONE IN THE SURFACE SOIL.} {SPRING GROWTH IS LATE}BUT NORMALLY GOOD GROWING CONDITIONS ARE PRESENT FROM APRIL TO EARLY JUNE. DURING HOT DRY SUMMERS THE WELL DRAINED SOILS ARE {PRONE TO DROUGHT SO PERMANENT GRAZING {LAND IS DEVELOPED ON DEEPER SOILS. THE MAIN CROPS ARE{WINTER WHEAT AND {WINTER BARLEY} WITH SMALL AREAS OF SPRING CEREALS FOR ROTATIONAL REASONS. SMALL AREAS OF{FODDER CROPS}ARE GROWN FOR THE DAIRY HERD. MOST OF THE FIELDS ARE IN SOME FORM OF GRASS/CEREAL ROTATION, EXCEPT FOR PERMANENT PASTURE LAND. {BURNING OF STUBBLE IS STANDARD PRACTICE. ALL BARLEY STRAW AND SOME WHEAT STRAW IS BALED FOR LIVESTOCK USE OR FOR SALE.
